intro: Gelibia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant species native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Gelibia thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal environments with high salt exposure. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
